Visions of Tomorrow: Contemporary Digital Art Exhibition

Tate Modern Gallery | January 15 - March 30, 2025

Exhibition Overview

Visions of Tomorrow showcases groundbreaking works from 12 pioneering digital artists exploring the intersection of artificial intelligence, human creativity, and emotional expression. This immersive exhibition features interactive installations, generative art, and AI-assisted sculptures that challenge our perception of authorship and creativity in the digital age.

Visitors will experience art that responds to their presence, evolves over time, and questions the boundaries between human and machine creativity. The exhibition includes virtual reality experiences, algorithmic paintings, and neural network-generated sculptures.

Featured Artists

Refik Anadol - "Machine Hallucinations: Dreams"

Turkish-American media artist Refik Anadol presents a mesmerizing 8K data sculpture created using machine learning algorithms trained on millions of architectural photographs. The installation transforms collective memory into dynamic visual narratives, creating fluid dream-like landscapes that challenge our understanding of space and memory.

  • Medium: AI-generated video installation
  • Dimensions: 12m × 8m LED wall
  • Year: 2024
  • Price: Installation value £450,000

Sougwen Chung - "Drawing Operations Unit: Generation 7"

Chinese-Canadian artist Sougwen Chung collaborates with custom robotic arms trained on 20 years of their drawing practice. This human-machine collaboration creates spontaneous compositions where AI responds in real-time to human gestures, exploring co-creation between biological and artificial intelligence.

  • Medium: Live robotic performance with ink on paper
  • Dimensions: Variable (performance space 5m × 5m)
  • Year: 2024
  • Price: Performance series £280,000

Mario Klingemann - "Memories of Passersby I"

German artist Mario Klingemann uses generative adversarial networks (GANs) to create an endless stream of unique portraits that never repeat. The artwork consists of two wooden consoles housing neural networks that generate male and female faces in real-time, each portrait existing for mere seconds before being replaced by a new creation.

  • Medium: Custom GAN-based installation
  • Dimensions: Two consoles, each 80cm × 120cm
  • Year: 2024
  • Price: £380,000 (unique work)
